sections.name: overview
sections.prompt: Provide a compelling 2-3 sentence overview that captures the historical significance and collector appeal of this military item.

sections.name: historical_context
sections.prompt: Describe the historical period, conflict, and military context in which this item was used or produced.

sections.name: physical_description
sections.prompt: Detail the physical characteristics including materials, construction, markings, and any identifying features.

sections.name: condition_assessment
sections.prompt: Provide an honest assessment of the item's condition, noting any wear, damage, repairs, or alterations.

sections.name: provenance
sections.prompt: If available, describe any known history of ownership, documentation, or chain of custody.

sections.name: collector_notes
sections.prompt: Include information relevant to collectors such as rarity, market demand, authentication considerations, and display recommendations.

description_structure.tone: authoritative yet accessible, historically informed, collector-focused

condition_criteria.Mint: Unused, complete with all original components, no wear or damage
condition_criteria.Near Mint: Minimal signs of age, complete, no significant wear
condition_criteria.Excellent: Light wear consistent with limited use, all original parts
condition_criteria.Very Good: Moderate wear, may have minor repairs, fully functional appearance
condition_criteria.Good: Obvious wear, possible repairs or replaced parts, presentable
condition_criteria.Fair: Heavy wear, damage, or significant alterations, sold as-is
condition_criteria.Poor: Damaged, incomplete, or heavily altered, for study/parts only

title.example: WWII German Luftwaffe Flight Jacket - Original Sheepskin Lined

authentication_prompts: Check for period-correct materials and construction methods
Verify markings, stamps, and labels against known references
Examine hardware, fasteners, and attachments for authenticity
Look for signs of artificial aging or modern reproductions
Compare to documented examples in reference books or museums
Consider professional third-party authentication for high-value items
